speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, quick, give me your museum membership card.

speaker: Frasier
text: What for?

speaker: Niles
text: I just heard tickets go on sale today for the exhibit of fourteenth century Japanese netsuki figurines.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, then the rumours were true?

speaker: Niles
text: Hurry, hurry, I want to get there before the line forms.

speaker: Roz
text: Five seconds. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just give me a minute, Niles.  Just sit tight, huh? [_on air, reading copy:_] And we're back.  Before we take our last call, I'd like to remind you that Mercy Hospital will be conducting free blood pressure testing this Saturday on Whidbey Island.  _Niles takes a peppermint out of his pocket and begins to unwrap it. The cellophane causes a crinkling noise which the microphone picks up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hypertension leads to strokes, heart disease and other maladies, so we should all be on the lookout for symptoms like shortness of breath, [_motions at Niles to stop_] quickening of pulse, irritability- [_presses cough button_] Oh, will you just shove the damn thing into your mouth! [_Niles puts the mint and wrapper into his mouth; lets go_] - So let's all join together to help defeat this silent killer. _Niles now tries to pull the sweet wrapper out of his mouth, causing more noise.  Frasier gestures him angrily into Roz's booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, who is on the line?

speaker: Roz
text: On line four we have Mac, who's recently moved here from Australia and he's having a problem with a co-worker.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Mac, welcome to Seattle, I'm listening.

speaker: Mac
text: [_v.o.; broad Australian accent:_] Well, mate, it like your Shelia said.  I'm working with a real yob-out.  He goes on and on about things nobody gives a billabong about just to show off how smart he is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you have my sympathy.  There's nothing more irritating than pointless and pretentious erudition.  My advice to you is to simply avoid him, is that possible?

speaker: Mac
text: [_v.o_] Not really, you bloody wallaby!  _Bulldog taps on the window behind him, he's making the prank call, others are gathered around him._

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're on right before me!  Stay tuned for the Bulldog. [_growls_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's one on me, or rather one on me and my call screener, Roz, whose ancestors were once heard remarking, "Oh, what a nice wooden horse, of course I'll sign for it." [_Roz is not amused_] This is Dr. Frasier Crane wishing you good mental health.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Gotcha!

speaker: Frasier
text: How many times have I asked you to desist with your adolescent antics?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I've got a sense of humour!

speaker: Frasier
text: I mean it, I'll go over your head!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_sarcastic_] Stop it, you're scaring me!

speaker: Roz
text: [_enters_] Listen, you sleazy little lyme tick, you do that one more time and I'll cut you off. [_he laughs_] And I don't mean mid-sentence!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_truly fearful_] Stop it, you're scaring me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you believe these hijinks I have to put up with?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Who would have thought it with a station whose current motto is, "Yakkety-Yak, We Talk Back"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, run along. [_hands him museum card_]

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Miss Costas, I'd like you to meet my brother, Dr. Niles Crane.

speaker: Kate
text: How do you do?

speaker: Niles
text: Enchante, I'd love to stay and chat but I'm off to get tickets for Frasier and me at the Japanese netsuki exhibit.

speaker: Kate
text: You'll love it.  I saw it in Kyoto.  It's just such a shame they're not letting the really rare pieces out of the country.

speaker: Niles
text: [_disappointed_] Oh. [_hands back card to Frasier_] As my Japanese gardener says, _Maimoshi chikosho._

speaker: Kate
text: Watch your mouth!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you speak Japanese? [_she nods_] Oh, I'll just retreat so that I can be one with my humiliation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Kate, can I have a word with you?

speaker: Kate
text: I'm in kind of a hurry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it'll just take a moment.

speaker: Kate
text: I seriously doubt that, but go ahead.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I've tried dealing with this problem on my own but Bulldog insists on interrupting my show with his foolish pranks.

speaker: Kate
text: I heard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I did not spend eight gruelling years at Harvard to be mocked by that juvenile jackass!

speaker: Kate
text: Shameless!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he's beyond shameless!

speaker: Kate
text: I'm talking about the way you manage to get Harvard into every conversation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure you'll mention your alma mater too some day - when it's credited!

speaker: Kate
text: Gee, you sure know how to ask for help!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm sorry.

speaker: Kate
text: I know, I'll take care of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just make sure he understands that...

speaker: Kate
text: [_quipping_] You went to Harvard, I know, I know. [_exits_]

speaker: Jack
text: [_v.o_] Hey, the key to this game is the husky secondary.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Jack, how can I put this to you delicately?  You're a moron! Shut up!  You know squat!  You know less than squat!  You and squat could go to the movies and squat could wear an "I'm With Stupid" T-Shirt!

speaker: Jack
text: [_v.o_] You're awesome, Bulldog.  Way to nail a blow on Dr. Crane!  You are the greatest!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, whatever, shut up. [_disconnects him_] Now, look, all you guys sending in any postcards to win tickets to the SeaHawks game - do I need another picture of the Space Needle? [_Kate enters_] Chicks in thongs!  Enough said? [_notices her_] We'll be back right after this. [_presses button_] Hey, what I just said, I'm sorry.  I meant to say women in thongs.

speaker: Kate
text: Stop busting Frasier's chops, enough said?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well I could, but see all these lines lit up?  They're all waiting to tell me how funny it was.

speaker: Kate
text: [_presses to his producer_] Are all these callers waiting to tell Bulldog how much they liked the joke he played on Frasier?

speaker: Pete
text: All except the guy on nine, he thinks Bulldog sucks.

speaker: Kate
text: Because of what he did to Frasier?

speaker: Pete
text: No, just in general.

speaker: Bulldog
text: So, what do you want me to do?

speaker: Kate
text: If you think I'm going to allow you to publicly mock one of our most respected hosts on air just for the sake of higher ratings, you and I are going to get along just fine!  _Kate and Bulldog give each other a smile.  FADE OUT_  **SINGING IN THE RAIN**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. We hear thunder as rain descends on the balcony outside the apartment. Eddie, is sat nervous on the Armchair as Daphne enters with some pat e. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on, Eddie, you love pate.  And this is the good stuff. [_Frasier enters_] Uh-oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Two syllables every homeowner loves to hear upon entering the door.  Would that have anything to do with the fact that you're feeding my imported foie gras to a dog?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sorry, but it calms him during the thunder.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, heaven forbid that Eddie should ever work a nerve! When Niles gets here we'll have sherry and snausages!

speaker: Daphne
text: That reminds me, Dr. Crane will be a bit late.  Your father asked him to stop at the vet and pick up some pills for Eddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm the one who's had a hard day.  How come no one ever brings me tranquilizers?

speaker: Daphne
text: I've often wondered that myself. _Frasier answers the phone.  The scene now cuts between Bulldog on air at KACL and Frasier on the phone in his apartment.  Bulldog is putting on a voice as a knot of grinning staffers crowd round him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_posh voice:_] Hello, this is Dr. Julius Irving.  I'm calling for Dr. Niles Crane, his receptionist said he might be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I am expecting him if you'd like to leave a message.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no, nothing important.  Some of the boys here at the club have a little bet going about "The Mikado."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, perhaps I can help.  I'm Niles's brother, Dr. Frasier Crane, and as luck would have it I was in an all-male version of "The Mikado" at Oxford.  People still ask to see my Yum- Yum.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't suppose you happen to remember the words to "Three Little Maids"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let me see.  Well, of course my falsetto isn't what it used to be but, um... [_falsetto:_] "Three little maids from school are we, prim as a school girl well may be, filled to the brim with girlish glee, three little maids from school!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, would you please be quiet?  I'm trying to settle a bet here.

speaker: Martin
text: You sure are!  Some caller bet Bulldog he couldn't make you sing over the air. [_laughs_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_normal voice:_] Sayonara, Doc! [_disconnects_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hangs up_] Well, Dad, I'm glad to see that you're amused, having your own son humiliated publicly.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, it's funny.  He makes everybody look stupid - the guys in the newsroom, Chopper Dave...

speaker: Frasier
text: That is not exactly a miracle transformation when it comes to Chopper Dave, a man whose life work consists of looking down at the freeway and saying, "Crowded"; "Not Crowded." [_picks up his coat_]

speaker: Martin
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Frasier
text: To the station!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Frasier, don't take it all so seriously.  You know, we played jokes like this all the time when I was on the force.  The day they replaced my bulletproof vest with a big lacy bra, I knew I was one of the guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad.  That also clears up a question that's troubled me for years concerning the night you were shot! [_exits_] _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Radio Station. Bulldog is still doing his show on air._

speaker: Bulldog
text: The "Salmon" that's what you want to name our expansion hockey team, "The Seattle Salmon"?!  Why don't you take your two IQ points, rub them together, see if you can't start a fire, beat it! [_presses another button_] Hey, you're in the doghouse!

speaker: Caller
text: [_v.o._] Hey, am I on?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yes, take as long as you want! [_presses another button_] Next.

speaker: Rob
text: [_v.o._] Hey, Bulldog, you're the man.  How about we name them "The Bulldogs"?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, you want to suck up?  Send money!

speaker: Rob
text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, I got another one. [_Frasier enters with a menacing eye_] What about "The Lizards"?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I hate lizards, they're disgusting.  They make my skin crawl. You're an idiot and you don't deserve to live!

speaker: Rob
text: [_laughing_] You're the best, Bulldog!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Shut up!  Back in thirty!

speaker: Frasier
text: I warned you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, hey, clear your jets.  Kate told me to keep busting ya'. Said it's good for ratings.  You got a beef, take it up with her!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_presses over to producer_] Pete, what did Kate say?

speaker: Pete
text: She said you're a pig.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, before that!

speaker: Pete
text: She said keep raggin' on the doc'!  _Frasier exits in anger.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - KACL Foyer. Frasier enters the foyer and goes up to Susan, her secretary._

speaker: Frasier
text: I want to talk to Kate now!

speaker: Susan
text: She's not in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unbelieving_] Oh, very clever, "she's not in."  Like that'll make me go away! _He storms into her office.  Reset to: Kate's Office Frasier finds she is actually not in.  Susan follows him._

speaker: Frasier
text: She's not in!

speaker: Kate
text: [_enters, to Susan:_] I need a copy of our contract with Nanette Stewart. [_notices Frasier_] What's Yum-Yum doing here?  It's all right, I can guess.

speaker: Frasier
text: You promised you'd put an end to Bulldog's shenanigans and instead you encouraged him. [_notices Kate has pulled Nanette's name from the board_] You're cancelling "Pet Chat With Nanette"?!  She's been on for six years.

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah, but she's been floating at the top of the bowl for the last two.  When I went in to talk to Bulldog, the phones were lit up like Times Square; his fans love it when he zaps you. _Kate walks out into the foyer, Frasier follows her.  Reset to: Foyer_

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you would have me ridiculed for the sake of those hyenas!

speaker: Kate
text: No, I would have you fight back.  He makes pot shots at you, you come back at him in your droll, Ivy League, "look at me, I've got a thesaurus" kind of way!  It'll be funny!

speaker: Frasier
text: Funny?!  Funny!? _Reset to: Hallway Kate walks to the hallway outside the booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: I refuse to engage in a battle of wits with a man who's favourite t-shirt reads "Seattle Hooter Inspector"!

speaker: Kate
text: Afraid of the competition?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am a doctor, I went... [_off her look_] ...to medical school! I will not embarrass myself by engaging in a grab for ratings.

speaker: Kate
text: You just announced to a half a million listeners that you are "filled to the brim with girlish glee."  I think the H.M.S Pinafore of embarrassment has sailed!  Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to fire someone. _Kate looks through the window at Nanette, who waves back at her with her little pet dog's paw._

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, God, she brought Spanky!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate, this is not over!

speaker: Kate
text: Do you know what your problem is?  You have no sense of humour.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am sick and tired of people telling me that!

speaker: Kate
text: Well, then, lighten up. [_exits to Nanette's booth_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: I asked the Raiders' defensive line to describe their tackling skills and here's what they said. [_cues tape_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o_] Three little maids from school are we, three little maids from school!  _Frasier scowls at him from behind the glass.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **THE NOSE KNOWS**  _Scene Five - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne answers the door to Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Good evening, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane.  Did you bring Eddie's pills?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and the vet gave very specific instructions. [_takes them out and reads_] "Take one tablet per hour or as needed until trembling subsides." [_realizes_] I'm sorry, these are for Maris. [_take some others out_] Those are for Eddie, here you go. [_hands them over_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll just hide his pill in a bit of food.  Like our Grammy Moon used to get grandad to take his heart medicine.

speaker: Niles
text: If he had heart problems, why wouldn't he want to take his medicine?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't think that nosy coroner didn't ask the same question! Num-nums, Eddie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's a good boy. [_strokes him_] Normally I don't believe in popping pills for every little upset.

speaker: Niles
text: I quite agree!  My nerves are bothered by this constant thundering, too, but I would never turn to drugs to calm down. [_sniffs his sherry_] Oh, mommy! _Niles takes a sip as Daphne rolls her eyes.  Martin enters from his room._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Niles, you're not going to believe what happened to Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I heard the whole thing. [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: You listen to Bulldog's program?

speaker: Niles
text: [_deadpan_] Yes, Dad, I can't sleep nights till I find out who hurled what ball through what apparatus. [_laughs_] No, no, no, no, it was on at the vet's. _Frasier enters.  He looks very angry and is soaked to the skin, he slams his umbrella down._

speaker: Frasier
text: You would think that in a city with this much rain that people would develop an etiquette about it, but no!  They buy umbrellas that are too big for them, you have to walk into the street to get around them and then they drive too close to the curb so that you're sure to get splashed!  And they wear brown shoes with white socks!

speaker: Daphne
text: What has that got to do with the rain?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing!  But I mean, really, get a fashion sense!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess things didn't go too well at the station, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, they didn't.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: It turned out the station manager is encouraging Bulldog's little pranks.  Now she wants me to return his fire on the air.  Well, I thought the idea was absurd at first but now I'm starting to warm to it.

speaker: Niles
text: I say have at him!  He's grossly overmatched but he did bring this on himself.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you're right, Niles.  If I have to fight cheap and dirty on his own turf, then I will!

speaker: Martin
text: [_unsure_] Uhhhh...

speaker: Frasier
text: And what is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't think it's a good idea.  You know, Bulldog's pretty good at this kind of thing.  He's a funny guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: And, I'm not funny?

speaker: Martin
text: Uhhhh...

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe this!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, now, obviously Dad's forgetting the time you took the names of our wine club board and turned them all into wickedly derisive anagrams! [_laughs_]  _They both laugh and shout out in memory "Sidney Ass Basket"! They laugh uncontrollably and soon Martin joins in._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, you see, dad, I made you laugh.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm looking at Eddie.  _Martin points Eddie out who seems to be knocked out from the sedatives.  Daphne notices and starts laughing with him._

speaker: Daphne
text: I guess he won't be needing a second pill!

speaker: Martin
text: Now, now, Frasier, don't get me wrong.  I think you're witty, you're clever, but funny's different.  Funny's somebody who makes you laugh with your belly.  Now, Bulldog's funny. Duke's cousin, Louie, now he's really funny!  He's like Jackie Gleason, only loud!  He makes you laugh so hard the beer comes out of your nose.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know what feels good through the nose?  A warm cup of cocoa. [_the rest look at her, she says in memory_] I just may go home for Christmas this year.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, just because I haven't caused anyone to blow beer through their nostrils doesn't mean that I can't.  Anyone who can compose a clever ballad can certainly master the intricacies of the whoopee cushion!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wouldn't be too sure about that.  It's a lot harder than you think.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you just tune into Bulldog's show tomorrow.  Pop open a beer and prepare for a Budweiser geyser!

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Frasier, if you're serious about that whoopee cushion, I happen to have one at the house. [_they all stare at him_] Last year a disgruntled servant left one on Maris's dining room chair.  Fortunately for all of us, embarrassment was averted when my little faun proved too light to activate it.   **LEAPIN' LIZARDS**  _Scene Two - Radio Station. Bulldog is doing his show as Frasier and Roz look in from the window._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, it's six-thirty, sports fans.  That means it's time for... [_cues fanfare music_] Our big SeaHawks tickets giveaway. Yes, my curvaceous and bodacious assistant Darlene is rolling in our glittery giant prize draw right now.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, Darlene, give it a good crank.  Whoa!  Honey, I meant the drum! [_cues a cranking noise_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here it comes, Roz, the hilarity ensues!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, explain this to me one more time.  You were the one who's trying to prove to everyone you're so funny, so why am I the one who had to put the lizard in the box?!

speaker: Frasier
text: It was just as difficult to be the lookout!  Stop whining!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, look who's here.  It's our new boss lady, KACL's own Kate Costas!

speaker: Roz
text: Kate's there?  Oh, Frasier, Kate's there!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's even better.  Even better that she will be an eyewitness to my little jape!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come in, Kate.  Yeah, here we go, glad you dropped in.

speaker: Kate
text: Hello, Bulldog.  Hi, Darlene. [_waves to Pete_] Wow, look at that mighty drum!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, give it a good spin! [_cues noise_] Look at those cards going round and round.  Okay, Seattle... and the winner is...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Kate, why don't you pick it?

speaker: Kate
text: Okay. [_reaches her hand in_] And the lucky winner is... YEOW!

speaker: Kate
text: Something bit me!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh my God!  It's a lizard! _Chaos ensues as Bulldog jumps up onto his console in terror, and Pete runs in to wrap his handkerchief around Kate's hand, while she is screaming in pain._

speaker: Kate
text: There it goes, there it goes, there it goes!

speaker: Kate
text: Stop that lizard, it has my finger!  _Frasier looks horrified.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Hospital. Everyone is laughing and joking in the waiting room.  Frasier arrives with a bouquet of flowers and hovers in the corridor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!  Any news?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah.  They sewed her fingertip back on.  She's gonna be fine.  Frasier, would you wipe that guilty look off your face? No-one even suspects you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why not?

speaker: Roz
text: Because you made such a big deal about how playing pranks was beneath you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, they're not only beneath me, they're beyond me.  I'm going to accept my limitations, and be satisfied to merely be witty and urbane.  Even my most barbed comments never drew blood! Oh God, I feel sick.

speaker: Roz
text: _You_ do?  When the lizard threw up her fingertip, who had to pack it in frozen yogurt and rush it down here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm going to tell her the truth.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!  Are you insane?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got to unburden myself.

speaker: Roz
text: [_impassioned_] Frasier, you didn't start this.  You are the victim here, why should you have to suffer any more than you already have?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll keep your name out of it!

speaker: Roz
text: Fine, do what you want. _Reset to: Kate's Room Frasier enters Kate's room to find her on her mobile phone.  A nurse is by her side._

speaker: Kate
text: [_into phone:_] I don't know when I'll be back in the office, Susan, just cancel all my appointments.  Is there any word on who pulled this stupid stunt?  I don't want excuses, I want names! [_hangs up_] Will you hurry up that shot, I'm in agony here. [_the nurse prepares to inject her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate, I see that your strength is back.  I brought you some flowers. [_hands them over_]

speaker: Kate
text: What kind of raving psychotic would do a thing like this?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, people use that word "psychotic" an awful lot these days.  A kid steals a candy bar, suddenly he's a psychotic.

speaker: Kate
text: I'm gonna find him and I'm gonna crush him!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to nurse_] Are you sure that's enough?  Make sure that all goes in!

speaker: Nurse
text: Call me if you need anything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Kate, I came here for a reason.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, let me guess, someone park in your space?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but if someone had, I would have forgiven him, just as I'm sure you will forgive...

speaker: Kate
text: Who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure the poor misguided prankster that perpetrated this evil deed really had no ill will in mind.  It wasn't his... or her... [_realises he can still weave his way out_] You know, that Nanette from "Pet Chat," she had a real axe to grind!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kate
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You giggled.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, [_laughs_] it was kinda funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kate
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: What's funny?

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, I was just remembering...

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kate
text: [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, the shot's kicking in, isn't it?

speaker: Kate
text: Wouldn't you know, it bites my middle finger.  How am I supposed to drive? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] You know, Kate, maybe now would be a good time...

speaker: Kate
text: Now you know, life is so funny.  One minute, you're standing in a hallway, the next minute you're a poo-poo platter for a lizard.  That's a funny word, isn't it?  Hallway!

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to hear something really funny?

speaker: Kate
text: And Bulldog, Bulldog's... [_laughing, then:_] Oh, see, now, you're starting to get tired, I should go. [_start to nod off_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate, Kate, before you go to sleep, there's just one last funny thing I want to tell you...

speaker: Kate
text: [_doped up_] O-kay!

speaker: Frasier
text: I put the lizard in the box.

speaker: Kate
text: O-kay.  _Frasier walks away as she falls to sleep.  However, before he gets to the door, Kate slowly presses the "head up" button on the bed which raises her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God!  It's alive!

speaker: Kate
text: [_half asleep_] You what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I, it was meant for Bulldog.  It was all an accident, I never intended to...

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate?  Kate?  _Frasier decides she's asleep and he's safe.  He turns to leave her...  CLOSE-UP: Like a cobra striking, Kate's hand snatches his wrist-  SMASH CUT TO: Waiting Room Roz and everyone in the waiting room jumps as Frasier screams:_

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s._] NURSE!
